conclusion: Determine heat transferred by ideal gas from state A to B to C.
Process involves two steps: A to B and B to C.
State A: p_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
State B: p_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 6 x 10^-3 m^3.
State C: p_C = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 2 x 10^-3 m^3.
Temperature at state A: T_A = 27°C = 300 K.
Find total heat transferred Q for process A to B to C.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W, thus Q = ΔU + W.
Use ideal gas law at state A to find number of moles n.
Calculate n = 0.1604 mol using p_A, V_A, R, T_A.
Calculate temperature at state B using ideal gas law.
T_B = 90.09 K using p_B, V_B, n, R.
Calculate temperature at state C using ideal gas law.
T_C = 45.01 K using p_C, V_C, n, R.
Calculate change in internal energy ΔU using ΔT.
Assume gas is diatomic, C_v = 5/2 R.
ΔU_{A to C} = -850.5 J using n, C_v, ΔT.
Work done by gas W = ∫ p dV.
Calculate W_{A to B} for isobaric process.
W_{A to B} = 200 J using p and ΔV.
Calculate W_{B to C} using area under curve.
